title: Professional-level WordPress
body: Professional-level WordPress needs to run flawlessly.  Besides Apache, MySQL, PHP 5.5, 5.6 & 7.0 that also means Nginx, MariaDB, Varnish, Redix and Memcached.

comments.body: Why in the world do you want to do this? Why not just run Linux at this point?

MySQL in Linux with NTFS is a big "NO, NO, NO!".
The solution could be a dedicated ext/zfs/xfs partition (inaccessible for Win though) and possibility to launch resident processes.
What's wrong with... everything WP needs installed in Win?
Is there a "professional-level" of WordPress? Sounds like "professionally-vulnerable" solution....
